summary: The Russian mob, led by Konstantine Konali (Ron Perlman), develops a computer game that, unbeknown to its players, has the ability to destroy security systems. As a result, a staggering number of robberies have been committed, and the Russian police have no leads. They call in the help of the Americans -- but think twice about that decision when they end up with the lovable, bumbling members of the Police Academy, including Eric Lassard (George Gaynes) and Thaddeus Harris (G.W. Bailey).

reviews.content: It's a shame this great franchise had to end on such a bad finale.
In typical Police Academy fashion, it was more mindless fun in Moscow
Bland, boring it was a far cry from the original

I have to give the Police Academy series one prop. They are like a collection of everything lazy and bad a comedy movie could ever think of doing to entertain an audience. Now that alone is not as easy as you might have thought.
fixes the worst of the franchise. was this movie supposed to be funny? because it failed

1994:  The force goes to Russia to help stop a computer game marketer from developing a game that would give him access to all of the users' security codes to bank accounts, etc.  This seventh entry in the series comes five years after #6; they should've waited much longer.  Even the most diehard PA fan would have trouble defending this "effort".  Jokes are generally tired and lame.  The regular gang looks embarrassed.  A torture to get through, and it is less than 90 minutes.  Oh, and Charlie Schlatter is not Steve Guttenberg, or not even Matt McCoy. 

Stars:  G.W. Bailey, George Gaynes, Michael Winslow, David Graf, and Ron Perlman.

A horrible conclusion to the Police Academy series but what can you expect when you've reached the seventh entry in a series that started sucking by the fourth film and never recovered after that, very obviously suffering from Steve Guttenberg's absence? I'm surprised they didn't shift the genre from comedy to horror by this time (don't oversaturated horror franchises usually become intentional comedies by the fourth or fifth entry?). The plot is lacking, the jokes aren't very funny, the cast has their talents gone to waste (Christopher Lee and Ron Perlman? What the hell are you two doing here?), the characters aren't all that compelling - not even those who stuck around since day one - and there's absolutely no enthusiasm or effort in the direction or screenwriting. And thus, it was with little surprise, that the Police Academy franchise was put down as Warner Bros. opted to move on to other, more profitable and more narratively superior franchises.

I will happily defend the Police Academy film as a series, but there is very little to defend about this one. Not even special appearances by CHRISTOPHER LEE and Ron Perlman can redeem this one.  Even for a comedy, the plot is nonsensical. There was very little comedic or dramatic tension, even where there should have been (nobody finds out about Cadet Connors cheating the system to go on the mission). However, there are one or two funny bits, especially Commandant Lassard's side adventure.

After Steve Guttenberg left the Police Academy franchise 5 and 6 were still pretty funny without him but Mission to Moscow might be one of the worst comedies/sequels ever made. When the film came out the trailers decide to talk extensively about the Cold War which is strange advertising for a comedy and when audiences saw that the Police Academy were in Russia they knew to stay away because it is just too ridiculous. It relies on too much slapstick which even for a Police Academy movie is saying something. It is way too predictable and it is a shame they ended a fun comedy franchise on such a bad comedy. The premise having the academy set in Moscow, Russia sounds creative but the result is just ridiculous enough to not make you enjoy it.

i agree this movie isn't as good as the ones before it. I did like seeing parts of Russia, like the banya and Gorky Park. interesting that filming took place with political discord throughout the country at the time (that and food shortages!)
Um...not all that bad. But not all that good either!
Soo lousy. It's no wonder the series died a slow death with this one. They even have quite a cast making cameos, but that can't help this mostly unfunny mess.
Not even the presences of Ron Perlman and Christopher Lee could save this overly cartoony, slapstick driven crapfest. Its only saving grace is the majority of the returning cast. 1.5/5.
5/15/2017: Possibly the worst movie I've ever seen!
This movie was alright, not as good as the original. Still funny and entertaining.

Hands down one of the greatest films of all time, and closing off the amazing Police Academy series. Stellar acting, astounding camera work, and great use of the Moscow location. This movie is a must watch, and will have you laughing so hard you'll pee yourself.
Awesome ending to a great series!
Only got a third of the way through and had to turn it off.
Gets an extra bit for having a gorgeous young Claire forlanni!!!
All the previous Police Academy films I find quite watchable, but this was a total piece of excrement.
Worst in the series, the cast is pretty much gone, I hated this one!
Please stop....just stop.

The only good thing about this really awful sequel is that the characters are out of their comfort zone and bring their zanyness to Russia but everything else is really embarrassing. How they managed to get a few first class actors is beyond belief. The script is childish and witless, the direction is all over the place and very unprofessional and worst of all...the acting is bad and doesn't even feel like it belongs in the franchise, it's definitely the worst sequel ever made and the worse in the series. It flopped and by watching this, you can tell. Watch it just to see how bad it is...or better yet, don't.
Not as bad as expected :)

This  is honestly the worst Police Adademy Movie I have seen, so far. It was really  .  .  . How can I say this? Mixing in a romantic story didn't really stirr well; it was because of Lesard, Captian Harris, and a few of the other Police Acedemy crew that kept it slightly enjoyable. I didn't really like watching this movie. I can understand why it is not the best is installment in the entire franchise. This is why I only give this a one star, because really, it's terrible.

"We're all off to Russia to kick many, many buttskies."  The Police Academy series may be dead, but they still have one last Mission to Moscow.  When the Russian police are unable to catch suspected mobster Konstantin Konali, they naturally turn to Commandant Lassard's Police Academy misfits.  The story is ridiculously awful and doesn't make a bit of sense.  And the Academy team is down to just Lassard, Tackleberry, Callahan, and Jones (and Harris if you consider him to be part of the team).  Yet there are some good actors slumming it here, such as Ron Perlman, Claire Forlani, and Christopher Lee.  Police Academy: Mission to Moscow aggressively tries to hit rock bottom, and it does so brilliantly...killing the series.

Woah this movie was the worst of the Police Academy series.  Captain Harris, one of my favorite characters to laugh at and laugh with, was very bad in this one.  He lost his authority in this movie...it just seemed like a rushed film.  Actually all the characters lost it in this one and the villain was TERRIBLE!!!Maybe I smiled once but I was not laughing like in the previous ones.
Police shit Academy just went to Russian and that's all you need to know because this movie blows watch it go.
I no longer find any of the films in this series funny. I had to watch this one just to be a 'completest'.  Police Academy 7 is devoid of any funniness, and has no laughs whatsoever.
The worst sequel of Police Academy and the worst sequel ever produced. How even this movie was made?

So Russia finally lets the US of A film in their country around important historical communist landmarks, and what is the first production to gain this honour...Police Academy 7.

The first sequence in the film and straight away I notice a huge blooper! The news reporter on TV is playing with a Gameboy (I think), apparently playing a new popular game. On closer inspection, as we get close ups, you notice there isn't actually a game cart in the back of the GB, utter fail in the first five minutes.

The plot kinda sounds OK when you think about it, the Russian mafia laundering money under the guise of a highly addictive and popular videogame. The bad guys use this game to be able to hack into any computer system it has been played on, hence they are able to commit many crimes. So Lassard and his best men are brought in to bring down this Russian gang led by a well cast Perlman.

The cast for this final outing is sparse, we still have Tackleberry, Jones, Callahan, and Harris, but we are missing many of the regular officers such as Hightower, Hooks, Proctor, Fackler, Nick Lassard and of course old Mahoney. This time without Nick Lassard as the Mahoney replacement, we have another replacement, this time for Nick Lassard! This new recruit looks like a young Matt McCoy (Nick Lassard) but has none of the charm, I'm not even sure why he's in the film really as he pretty much does nothing.

That is the whole problem with this film, nothing actually happens. There aren't really any pranks, not many laughs, no training sequences (thank god) and not much plot excitement. There is one amusing sequence where Harris and Tackleberry join in on a Russian ballet performance in full get up, but that's about it really. There are some silly acrobatics from some Russian cops that seem to be mute, a mediocre car chase and a small hint of humour. Not even Harris or his Russian equivalent can help this film.

Unfortunately its a poor exit for the franchise with this final film, the last film was quite good at times but this is really dull and not at all visually exciting, its all filmed on location in Russia but it looks grim. Cultural differences are of course used but none of it really works, its just not funny. The fact that Cmdt. Lassard spends half the film AWOL with a Russian family merely by accident just seemed like the writers had no idea what to do with him, he's virtually a cameo. Quick mention for Christopher Lee who looks quite good as the Russian Cmdt. but I have to wonder why he agreed to this bottom of the barrel flick. The final curtain falls on this quite historic franchise but not to a standing ovation I'm afraid, bit of a stinker.
Failed attempt at reviving the series, loses steam but, mildly entertaining nonetheless.
These movies got 0% from the critics ever since the 4th one I don't blame the critics at all the Leprechaun Franchise is better than this franchise

We're really beating that dead horse now.  Lassard and what is left of the crew go to Moscow to help apprehend a top Russian mobster.  Contains less poor slapstick than the last two but I'm not sure I laughed once during this.
This last one of the series is a total disappointment.
I like this movie because it is so funny.
One of the worst movies ever made. I'd imagine having broken glass rammed up your backside would be infinitely funnier than this very sorry excuse for a comedy.

I own this in a seven movie pack along with:
    * Police Academy (1984)
    * Police Academy 2: Their First Assignment (1985)
    * Police Academy 3: Back In Training (1986)
    * Police Academy 4: Citizens On Patrol (1987)
    * Police Academy 5: Assignment Miami Beach (1988)
    * Police Academy 6: City Under Siege (1989)

Tried to hard to bring the same humor from the first movies. Still not very good though. The scene with the egg being thrown from one mouth to the other was funny and disgusting at the same time. I hope this is the last one.

Clearly, a guilty pleasure. Although it was a letdown from the previous Police Academy's, it was nice to see Christopher Lee and Ron Perlman in this.

Also I was a little disappointed as several of the main characters from the previous films weren't in here, but this was still fine.
the best actres here is the beauty claire forlani
This one went beyond stupid.
The Worst in the series but worth a watch.Though only a few old characters left,I still have some laugh out laugh moment.:)
Wow wasn't funny at all.  The storyline was nonexistent.  It was just so bad.
Not as good as other Police Academy movies

When I reviewed the first six films, the clear indicator of the poor story quality was the rushed pre-production period. This wasn't the case here though. This film is a mess and is an odd mix of slapstick and no storyline. Why did they need to go to Russia? Laughable. It's exactly like going to Miami. They don't have jurisdiction. This was a final nail in the coffin for the franchise and I can't defend the film series. Number 6 has a few well constructed moments, but there is nothing here. No real reason for existing and it's not even by the numbers, it's just bad. One of the worst films ever created and showcases the issue of filmmaking in the studio system. A sad goodbye for the cast and they didn't even respect the audience by bringing back everybody. 12/12/2019
god I can't believe these movies actually made it to part 7 lol who is watching this shit

So they finished on seven. Comfortably, convincingly, easily the worst police academy documentary of the lot. I did manage to laugh twice though which thus represents my two very kind stars. However, if anyone has ever seen a certain film known as the Transporter they'll know that this Police Academy 7) deserved oscar nominations at the very least by comparison. Just so we're clear,  The Transporter is shit . . .

Not only is this this worst film of the franchise but this is also one of the worst films ever made. Quite what possessed Gaynes, Winslow and Graf to return for a seventh time each, Easterbrook for a sixth and Bailey for a fifth will forever escape me. Was it contractual obligation cause it can't have been the money, the budget on this is so shockingly low that it makes others in the franchise look epic in their budgets. The cast are so badly served by the script that Winslow barely utters a word in his own voice and the rest simply seem to wonder around in a daze. Lee is quite clearly slumming it, though during the 90's he wasn't exactly known for being picky and Perlman has never been one to turn down a job either. Schlatter is the new addition to the cast no doubt thrown in by producers to hopefully appeal to a younger audience, the following year he'd join Diagnosis Murder(!), and desperately trying to fill Guttenberg and McCoy's shoes as the cheeky chappy lead. Thank god the franchise ended their I don't think the world could have stood another dose of Police Academy.
This last one of the series is a total disappointment.

Clearly, a guilty pleasure. Although it was a letdown from the previous Police Academy's, it was nice to see Christopher Lee and Ron Perlman in this.

Also I was a little disappointed as several of the main characters from the previous films weren't in here, but this was still fine.
"Why do you think I took you to all those Police Academy movies? For fun? I didn't hear anyone laughing, DID YOU?"
Not the best one but still funny

The final chapter in what was a roller coaster of comedy. Returning are some of your faves from the academy. Unfortunately, their standard routines return with them.  
This installment, even though ripe with possibilities due to the Russian connection, falls prey to using the exact same gags we've seen in the past 6 films of the series.  Add to that the fact that the film returns to using skits rather than a flowing story and you end up with a bunch of sporadic bits that aren't exactly entertaining.
Short of possibly keeping your 7 or 8 year olds occupied for an hour and a bit, this mission to Moscow was a bust.
Pretty stupid at this point. Leaving Hooks and Hightower behind was not smart. Too hokey as well.

The final installment in the police academy's, and im glad to say thank god.
No mahoney and the team working alongside captain harris, its dire in places. Lots of russian related jokes but not enough to even make you laugh. No hightower or hooks.

The film that killed it all, the fact they waited 4/5 years to get it made says it all. Half of the cast bailed. when hightower and harris's comedy sidekick bails that should answer everything you need to know about this film!
  The gang (3 of them) go to russia to assist the russian police force take down a mob boss and something to do with a awfyl computer game played on a gameboy???

Its a shame really the theme kicks in,your expecting a bad but friendly fun kind of film but you just get an awful film which is just not funny in any way apart from embarising. Not even the hot claire forlani on screen could make it worth sitting threw!

Usually when I see a comedy I enjoy myself even if the movie is bad. I didn't even accomplish that while watching "PA7." I like the characters of Graf, Winslow, Easterbrook, and company but in secondary roles not as the main characters. More than the others this film really showed the need for Guttenberg's character. The jokes were pretty stupid and made me roll my eyes more than laugh. Ron Perlman could have made a good villain if he wasn't made out to be a fool.

Amazing how the series turned from a raunchy and crude 80's hit to a kid pleasing cop show in just ten years.
booooo... nothing actually happens and there is rarely a joke told. gaynes is good but thats it.

Five years after you thought this dead horse had received it's last flogging, out comes the whip again. This time around Lassard, Jones, Tackleberry, Callahan, Harris and new guy Connors (Charlie Schlatter, filling the "Mahoney" slot... badly) are heading to Russia to help in the capture of master criminal Ron Perlman, who wants to take over the world with Game Boys! With terrible humour, poor characters (the Russian "Three Stooges" are horrendous) and an overreliance on Russian cliches and stereotypes (comedy accents, borscht, ballet, the circus, saying "ski" at the end of everything), it's no surprise that Mission to Moscow finally killed the Police Academy movie series for good. There are many low points - Connors' pursuit of pretty Russian translator Claire Forlani (why do they need a translator when everyone speaks English?), the aforementioned Three Stooges... but the waste of Cpt. Harris is probably the worst. G.W. Bailey is game as always but with no bumbling sidekick to play off of he seems lost, and it robs the film of what had up to this point been a reliable lifeline of good gags. To be fair to the cast, they all seem to be giving it their best shot, but with so little life left in the franchise the situation was pretty much hopeless.

Absolutely one of the worst comedy films I have seen. It doesn´t have any worthy jokes and it is so f****** boring!
The series gave what it had to give and so it is better not to try it more...

Review #317 Comedy

Well atleast the franchise decieded to stop, only thing is, the sixth should've been the last.
stop making them please 5 was enough
The worst of the series, Jones with the safe was just abysmal.
It was OK. Not amazing, but OK. Worth a watch if you love Police Academy. Was a big shame that most of the original cast were missing...oh well
OH, good lord why, what has the world done to deserve this!?

Certainly the worst in the series, the seventh and last. Although their are a few laughs, the humor is just too juvenile and stupid, it?s simply not very funny. They have taken the Police Academy series just a little too far and they have used all the good stuff by now and the writers were really stretching it.

28/100. Certainly the worst in the series, the seventh and last. Although their are a few laughs, the humor is just too juvenile and stupid, it's simply not very funny. They have taken the Police Academy series just a little too far and they have used all the good stuff by now and the writers were really stretching it.
Oh forgot one more crappy movie

The original cast members have dwindled and they're running out of ways to rehash the story, time to send them all to another country. You know what, if you watched one through six and thought they were all funny, then go right ahead and add this to your collection, otherwise avoid it as though it were the plague.
awful. just plain awful. even at less than 90 minutes its too long.
Ah yeah its no longer funny or enetraing it should of stopped 3 or 4 sequals ago but no Lets make seven films and call it even. 2/10
Probably the worst of the Police Academy series and get a full star only for the stunningly gorgeous Claire Forlani who can make me sit through just about anything!

Police Academy aren't the greatest films of all time...but they are usually good for a bit of a chuckle....However this is the exception, the humor is horrendous so childish. The plot is is absolutely ridiculous...you can take over the world with a video game...go figure! The only good thing about this film is Claire Forlani and even she would have this film low on her resume I'm sure!! Christopher Lee kissing Lassard (on the lips)...a must not see in cinema!! Clearly a film intended to be a cash cow...but made no cash, leave the series at Number 6 (City Under Siege)
The Police Academy movies are great but this one is VERY VERY poor and most the original cast have left by this point.
Im a big fan of the Police Academy movies and have the boxset but this one is just pure TERRIBLE, the worst of the lot and most of the original cast has gone.
If Police Academy couldn't get any worse.. it did!!!

Wow.  This movie was a total mess.  The only good part was Claire Forlani who I fell in love with.  It was also interesting to see Ron Perlman, although he is TERRIBLE in this film.  The series would have been better off ending with installment 6.
Loved Police Academy but as soon as Steve Guttenberg was replaced it all fell apart....only Leslie Esterbrook kept me hooked for the remaining films..just barely...

(*): Thumbs Down

Pure crap.
Thankfully the franchise was finally put out of it's misery after this disaster. Terrible.
I loved this film even though it is a late contender

Kicking buttski. Making you laughski. The Academy is backski! As muchzki I likzi  Police Academy Trilogy, I waski tiny bitzki dissapointed, but just tiny bitzki.

The only Police Academy movie not to make over a million dollars. No Wonder!
Oh my!   What a terribly awesome shitfest!  Interesting only because it has Ron "Hellboy" Perlman, Christopher Lee and a pre-Mallrats Claire Forlani.  Stick with Citizens on Patrol!

I kind of liked this one better than the last few, but it is still cheesy and out of place. The cast has gotten small and a lot of the original characters are gone. But the story of this one was a little more solid. I just wish there was more too it or many it would of been cool to have some cameos from the old cast.
The ONLY Police Academy I hated.I could NOT watch it all
The Funny Sixth Part of the Police Academy Series
By far one of the worst movies of all time if not the worst or does it tie with crystal skull? bad everything!im not going to go on as its making me feel sick thinking about this movie.
Huge Police Academy fan! Not the best in the series but far better than Police Academy 6!

a sad sad sad end the the series quite a good cast but there just wasnt anyhing left in the tank if you see it in the bargin bin atthe video store or on the net for cheap dont wste your money dont cae howw cheap it is
leslie easterbrook transforms through the series from a hot police chick to MILF to a potential GMILF...
I guess this one was an overkill ...
There haven't been many films that I can't struggle my way through to the end. This one I quit after half an hour. 'Nuff said.
You would think it hard to dumb-down this series, but for the last instalment they have managed it.  The slapstick comedy and music are a poor substitute for the early PA comic success.

Oh my god, this has to be one of the worst movies ever made... How Christopher Lee landed in this pile of crap is beyond me. The first police academy movies were fun, but this is just shit. There are lame movies, there are retarded movies, there are so-bad-theyre-good movies, there are plain awful movies, and then theres this... I rarely want to cry during movies... It happened while watching Big Fish, Grave of the Fireflies and this... not for the same reason though...

there were seven parts of that shit ???
Why oh why didn't they stop with Citizens on Patrol? End on a high note, y'know? Go out in style, not like Fat Elvis.
Please let this be the LAST of the films in this franchise... please...

- on dvd -
A little over a year ago I made a bad investment. I bought the Police Academy box sex collection which featured all seven movies. The first one is still okay and reasonably funny but still not great. The second it worse and the third one awful. The fourth one saved the series a little but then the fifth and six are shockingly bad, worse than ever before. Then we have the seventh one. Why the fuck are such highly acclaimed stars such as Christopher Lee, Ron Perlman and Claire Foralani appearing in this movie. This however does not save the movie. The production values are also better in this movie than any of it's predecessors but the content has just become better produced shit. Poor movie which bored the shit out of me. I hope they never make another one of these movies.
